programme.title: Swordfish
programme.desc: A spy (John Travolta) working for the CIA forces a computer hacker (Hugh Jackman), who was recently released from prison, to help steal unused government funds.

programme.title: Gothika
programme.desc: A criminal psychologist (Halle Berry) awakens to find herself confined in a penitentiary, accused of murdering her husband (Charles S. Dutton).

programme.title: Spawn
programme.desc: A clown from Hell allows a badly scarred man, Al Simmons, to return to Earth on a mission to conquer the world. Simmons agrees in hopes of seeing his wife, but must ultimately choose between good and evil.

programme.title: The Black Cobra
programme.desc: A detective (Fred Williamson) protects a murder witness (Eva Grimaldi) from a vicious gang of bikers.

programme.title: The Black Cobra 2
programme.desc: Interpol pairs a Chicago policeman (Fred Williamson) with an inspector (Nicholas Hammond) on the trail of terrorists in Manila.

programme.title: Black Cobra 3: Manila Connection
programme.desc: An agent (Forry Smith) teams up with his father's buddy (Fred Williamson) on a jungle mission to recover stolen weapons.

programme.title: Showtime At The Apollo
programme.desc: The host is LL Cool J; musical guests are Donna Allen and the Breakfast Club; comedian is Rick Aviles.

programme.title: It's Showtime at the Apollo
programme.desc: Malcolm-Jamal Warner guest hosts. Performers include Salt-N-Pepa, Angela Winbush, and comedian Steve O.

programme.title: It's Showtime at the Apollo
programme.desc: Guest host Richard Belzer. Performers include The Cover Girls, Tony Terry, and Anthony Bailey.

programme.title: It's Showtime at the Apollo
programme.desc: Freddie Jackson sings, A Tribe Called Quest perform, and Ed Alonzo does a comedy-magic act.

programme.title: It's Showtime at the Apollo
programme.desc: Howard Hewett; Bel Biv Devoe; comic Dana Point.

programme.title: The Other Side
programme.desc: A director learns that a serial killer is using his old horror film as inspiration for his crimes and must conquer the evil within himself.

programme.title: Executor
programme.desc: When an orphan becomes an assassin, the priest who ran his orphanage gives him his assignments. After one of his missions goes wrong, he finds himself questioning his beliefs and deeds.

programme.title: Redeeming the Time
programme.desc: A high school football star's faith is put to the test when an unthinkable tragedy strikes his family.

programme.title: The Deadly Art of Survival
programme.desc: A martial arts instructor struggles with drug dealers who are operating from a rival karate school called the Disco Dojo.

programme.title: Judge Dad
programme.desc: Matthew is suing his roommate Elliot for stealing his food deliveries and never reimbursing him for his share of the bills; Elliot claims they always had an arrangement where they share everything.

programme.title: Judge Dad
programme.desc: Dana is suing her former best friend for ruining her hair and causing chemical burns.

programme.title: Judge Mom
programme.sub-title: Don't Look a Gift Horse in the Mom
programme.desc: Lauren is suing her brother, Todd, to recoup money their mother loaned to him; Todd claims the money was a gift, not a loan, and that he's not responsible for any of his mother's healthcare expenses.

programme.title: Crime Stoppers: Case Files
programme.desc: The unsolved murders of Sergeant Chris Reyka and Elites Morin.

programme.title: Snakes on a Plane
programme.desc: An FBI agent must contend with a swarm of deadly serpents that have been released aboard an airliner to kill the witness he is escorting to trial.

programme.title: B.A.P.S
programme.desc: Two waitresses from Georgia fly to Los Angeles to audition for a music video. They want to start a business that combines soul food with a hair salon. They end up at the estate of an elderly millionaire. They bond with him and his butler.
